website_summaries.verdict: Worth considering for owners of large vehicles and those who like the idea of its easy-to-use automatic functions.
pros: Can charge most vehicle batteries, including those found in trucks and SUVs
Adjusts amp output for reliable charge
LED display is easy to read and serves as a guide while batteries charge
cons: Design is somewhat bulky and one of the pricier options we considered

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and works well.
customer_reviews.text: The charger works as advertised. As with any charger it is important to remove any latent surface charge from the battery so the charger can read an accurate voltage. I found this charger read accurate battery charge. If you find it was at say 70% while charging, you disconnect and reconnect and it says 100% that is the surface charge. Turn your headlight on for 30 seconds before connecting the charger the second time and it will read accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Moberg

customer_reviews.title: The price is right
customer_reviews.text: Works. Charges. You have to encourage it a bit on dead batteries as it sometimes registers them as no good. Just keep turning the unit on and off and it will eventually start charging.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great charger
customer_reviews.text: I waited awhile to write a review so I could test it out. Easy to hook up and decent charging speed. I've seen others say that it cuts off after a certain period of time. I thought the same thing at first but even though you don't hear it the unit continues to charge and shuts off when fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Halligan

customer_reviews.title: You can’t go wrong with Schumacher, I have been using they’re products for the last 45 years
customer_reviews.text: Unit works exactly as advertised, and it’s very easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: randall s boltz

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to its adds
customer_reviews.text: This charger replaced one that was 30 years old. The electronics that show state of charge work as as advertised. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is, I feel the clamp springs should be a bit beefier. Not a major issue. Over all the charger works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: The Woodmeister

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have one of these.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. He uses it on the farm for his John deer tractor. It was one of the BEST GIFTS I have ever given him. I would recommend this for everyone to keep in their car.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S

customer_reviews.title: Great charger!
customer_reviews.text: So far this charger has been great, feels very quality compared to my last one and has a low amp charging option too. If you want a charger that can also jump start if needed this is a great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: james dye

customer_reviews.title: read instructions for the 100A or car will no longer start
customer_reviews.text: Well I hooked it up and turned it up to 100A, and tried to jump my car. Nothing happened in fact even with normal jumpers the whole thing was dead, dash lights would no longer turn on at all (but hazard lights still worked). Turns out the instructions say to turn it to "100A jump" and then wait 3 minutes for it to say "ready" instead of just "on". So needless to say I blew the 80A main fuse in the fuse box (replaced it and all is well now). So read the instructions first, don't do what I did, if your battery is totally dead!
customer_reviews.author: rogerdpack

customer_reviews.title: Charges too high.
customer_reviews.text: Charges my 12v battery to above 15.5v....verified on 2 different batteries that it just keeps charging at way too high a voltage. Pretty sure the charger is a bad one. Will be contacting for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous battery charger!!
customer_reviews.text: This charger will cook your battery. I have different tractors and vehicles on my place that are not driven regularly, hooked this charger up and it charged the battery just fine, problem was that it would not stop charging i heard my battery giving off a bubbling gassing sound hooked it to another battery same thing happened. This will cook and destroy a battery and can cause an explosion due to the gassing and heat created caused by charger not shutting itself off. Shipped back, Amazon refunded my money. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: A Guy Named Linzy

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't read a bad battery.
customer_reviews.text: My car wouldn't start, so I used this to charge the battery. The display indicated that it was charging and five to six hours later it indicated that it was fully charged and maintaining the battery. I dropped the battery back in the car and had no change. Still suspecting it was the battery I took it to O'Reilly Auto Parts and they put it on their machine and it read that the battery was bad. This charger has a LED light that lets you know if the battery is bad but for some reason it couldn't tell???
customer_reviews.author: Dennis/Annie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working - 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Good delivery, so no problems there. The product is junk. Upon receiving, the from panel was de-laminating from the housing. It's basically a big sticker (label) over the LEDs and buttons. Figuring "well, not unusual for today's typical junk offered to Americans, so I just accepted the poor quality in hopes that internal functionality of the charger would work and last like my 30 year old charger. BIG MISTAKE. 2 months later, it no longer charges batteries. I had to pull out old faithful (Sears 30 year old charge). Then discovered the same model is offered in Walmart. SAY NO MORE.........
customer_reviews.author: Parent

customer_reviews.title: Boiled my battery
customer_reviews.text: Auto shutoff does not work. Mine switches to 30A boost on its own even if I preselect the 6<>2A & AGM setting. (Then why have the 2A button?!, hint to mfr: perhaps I don’t want to charge my battery at 30A!) Both of these ‘features’ boiled my AGM battery and nearly caused an explosion. Was on hold for hours with customer service and could never reach a person to help address the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Bad Experience
customer_reviews.text: After being helped by a friend who had a unit like this (different brand), I bought the Schumacher. I charged the unit as instructed. I went to use it a month later and it had no charge. After that it would not take a charge, absolutely useless! Took it to local electronic recycling for disposal. Waste of time and money. I give it a 1 rating only because the system will not accept a 0.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Very happy was my choice.
customer_reviews.text: My old Schumacher battery charger didn’t seem to be working at all. It was time to replace it and I chose another Schumacher because I know they are a quality product. I hooked it to my battery that had sit all winter totally drained. I didn’t know if their was any hope but I checked periodically and after a few hours it was at 100%. Very easy to understand and use.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Crowther

customer_reviews.title: Started my John Deere Riding Mower with Dead Battery
customer_reviews.text: It provided enough current to start my John Deere with a completely dead battery. Just FYI, it takes 13,8 V to charge a 12 v battery. The person that said the voltage was too high (@14V) does not understand that the charging voltage must be higher than the battery voltage.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Plusses: I bought this because I need to charger both 6V and 12V systems. So far I have used it on both systems with no issues. I is great that it senses when the battery is charged so that it doesn't overcharge the battery. Drawbacks: It took a few weeks to ship...out of stock?
customer_reviews.author: ras12

customer_reviews.title: Bad battery
customer_reviews.text: Got product. Plugged it in to charge and a error message kept popping up with a red light that said "bad battery." That's the extent on my experience. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: ARandomGuyTwiceRemoved

customer_reviews.title: Will not start my car and it's a  4 banger.
customer_reviews.text: This product will not jumpstart a car period. Not a Jeep not a small 4 cyl. I tried on both waited the required time and no go. And yes I had a good connection. So it is an expensive regular 30 a charger with features that don't work. Also when trying to start the car watch the wires they will get hot. Yet another annoying thing is that it defaults to charging agm batteries. You would think it would be standard but no. So you have to use the button to cycle all the way back to the option to charge a standard battery. I am returning and buying a standard 30a charger for 20 bucks less.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Panoussi

customer_reviews.title: BAD
customer_reviews.text: The first one had to be sent back as soon as I got it. The replacement went bad 10 days after the return window closed. Tried different batteries and it is locked on 100% charged and shut down.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Fegles

customer_reviews.title: Schumacher is a very good brand...
customer_reviews.text: We had an old Schumacher literally for over a decade, and it just finally died. This one is much more functional for our times. It won't let you make a mistake with reverse polarity. It gives excellent digital readings on what's going on while it charges. It won't let you over charge your battery. Haven't tried the "jump start" feature yet, but I'm convinced it will work fine. Yes, I would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Constance A. Jeffs

customer_reviews.title: What a joke
customer_reviews.text: Has bells and whistles, worked for a while now will NOT charge 6 volt battery, recognizes 12 volt AGM battery as a 6 volt. Hook to 6 volt car battery, select standard battery, it says it's charging and after 12 hours it says 0 percent charge and it is correct. Hook up a cracker box cheapy charger to same battery and charges battery just fine. waste of money Hook up to AGM 12 volt and it thinks its an 8 volt, charges to 8 volts then goes to 'charged, maintaining' - check with probe and multimeter and sure enough, charged to 8 volts.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID H.

customer_reviews.title: Saved a completely dead battery - all automatically.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent charger. I have a special car tucked away in the garage that I only get out on nice days. Sometimes it sits longer than it should and recently I came out to find the battery completely drained - dead, can put. My old charger (25 years old or more) just couldn't cut it. I even tried jumpstarting it... nothing. I ordered this unit from Schumaker, clipped it on and walked away. It cycles through lower settings to bring up a battery that's been sitting idle and when I came back later, the car started right up - no problem. It was brought it right back to life. No must, no fuss. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Performed like a CHAMP!!!
customer_reviews.text: Connected the charger to my DEAD as a DOORNAIL Walmart battery AFTER I READ THE instructions on the charger. It properly charged my battery just as advertised....FYI it PAYS to READ the instructions that come with this charger so that you can properly operate and connect the charger so it can do it's thing. I ALMOST did not purchase this battery charger based on some of the reviews. I'm GLAD that I didn't follow the advice on some of the bad reviews....and for the price??? It can't be beat....
customer_reviews.author: Byron Brinker

customer_reviews.title: Schumacher Does what it says guaranteed!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a brand new battery but something in the fusebox in my 2013 impala was draining it fast so I bought this by high reviews and I'm very impressed!! Brought it from dead to 100%!! Now mind you? Its "corded" for garage but it's needed anyway for just in case I need a longer ext cord for longer reach so took the battery out and hooked it up overnight is the best way set it and forget it. I love it! You won't be disappointed at all!! Well worth the money by the name itself!
customer_reviews.author: HONDA

customer_reviews.title: Good little charger !
customer_reviews.text: We have a 97 Mitsu 3000 GT that since the day it was new has had a very low battery drain that Mitsu and 5 other service professionals over the years have not been able to find. We don't drive it often anymore, so if it sits for more than a few weeks the battery drains down enough that it needs to be jumped. I finally bought this charger and so far it has worked perfectly in keeping the battery charged and ready to go. Very easy to use. Should have bought this years ago !
customer_reviews.author: Fauxpainter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for When It's Needed
customer_reviews.text: The Schumacher SC1281 6/12V Fully Automatic Battery Charger is the ideal car battery charger for owners of trucks, SUVs and larger vehicles. It can easily charge a wide variety of battery types, such as AGM, gel, and deep-cycle batteries, along with standard batteries. Packing a little more punch than a regular car battery charger, the SC1281 is designed for those vehicles that are larger than your average car. With a 30A quick boost and 100A jump start, this charger gets the job done for your SUV or truck.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Rootes Author

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet expectations
customer_reviews.text: Did not meet expectations. I'm wondering if the internal electronics were OK. The unit appeared to be previously used or refurbished. There were tell-tale signs: charger was dusty, had aftermarket twist ties, and was placed in the box upside-down.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Scholtz, PhD, RD

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a month
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a month then started reading voltage when not hooked up to anything and would start charging sequence before hitting the start button. When hooked up to a battery it would shut off after 10-30 seconds then turn itself back on. There essentially is no control of it with the buttons, the only way to keep it from turning itself on is to unplug it. Started a small engine business and was hoping this thing would last at least a year or two but the headache of returning and the need for a charger in a small engine shop means it’s just a paperweight now.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Jondreau

customer_reviews.title: Buying from Amazon versus Wearhouse direct with return policies are open on defective products
customer_reviews.text: August 17, 2020: This Schumacher charger was purchase May 31, 2020 from Amazon, used twice and stop after 4 hours. Contacted factory direct, talked to engineer, he told me the unit was unrepairable (transformer) for me to contact the seller Amazon and request this unit be return and replace for another (new). Amazon policy is after 30 days they do not accept returns. I will thick twice before buying any costly product from Amazon in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jose M. Sibila

customer_reviews.title: Quality, safety and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a completely discharged standard car battery. I set it for a slow complete charge. I like all the built in safety features. It is well made and very easy to use. Also has a battery maintenance feature which is nice. It’s a nice unit. Do you need a battery charger? I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Puma

customer_reviews.title: Should have been a new one for the money
customer_reviews.text: Should have been a new one, not a returned one I paid over $69.00 for a new charger, and now it is @ $59.00 for a new one, I was cheated "you think" that is why 2 stars, so far it is working if I wanted a used one it was less then I paid, SO BEWARE
customer_reviews.author: Nickro

customer_reviews.title: First Experience Battery Charger Seems To Work
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a battery charger. This seems to work well. I don't quite understand DC power or how this charges. I am using it on my riding mower during the winter. It keeps it charged. I though the light indicators would go from "charging" to "maintaining", but that doesn't seem to be the case. Again, I don't quite understand it but it is working. The instructions say not to use an extension cord. I am using a very old (probably 30+ years) extension cord and the run is probably 100 feet and there is not problem with charging. I have not had a dead car battery yet to test the engine start capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: TAXX

customer_reviews.title: Great Product-worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: It was surprisingly easy to use. Just follow the direction and it almost works automatically. It defaults to an agm battery setting- I didn't know what that was. It would have been better if the default was to 'standard' battery setting. The only other issue I had was the transition from charging to maintenance- I waited 30-40 mins and it still was on charging/100%- came back after an hour and it had changed to green. Otherwise everything worked flawlessly. Alternator testing worked. I did not try jump start. The real problem is not driving much with the coronavirus. A lot better than waiting around for AAA.
customer_reviews.author: MurftheSurf

customer_reviews.title: Not a good Battery Charger
customer_reviews.text: The unit totally overcharged a 12v, wet cell RV battery.... did not shut down or slow down charging. Luckily I was monitoring as it was boiling the electrolyte away. Second time I used it and too expensive to pack and ship under warranty. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: It had already been returned! Dirty and scuffed!
customer_reviews.text: This item had already been opened! Obviously returned! It was dirty all around and has scuff marks too! No plastic around the item. The cords were just slung inside the box and not wrapped as usual. This was a birthday gift and too late to return. My husband noticed right away that it had already been opened and it was nearly falling out the bottom of the box and didn’t sit straight up. I was so embarrassed! If it doesn’t work, I’m returning for an exchange! So sad that I paid that much money for a used and scuffed up dirty item!
customer_reviews.author: Anirta

customer_reviews.title: Confusing and unreliable!!
customer_reviews.text: The most confusing battery charger ever!! Every time you plug and unplug it from the battery the readings are different! Can never tell if the battery is charged at 100% or 60% as the numbers keep changing. At other times it read the battery voltage at 0 and in 20 secs after it was removed and again attached back to the battery it read 12! Cannot be trusted and don’t know if it actually charged the battery or not! Returned back to Amazon! It’s a good brand and wanted it to work but unfortunately it was poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: MTFBWY

customer_reviews.title: Tendency to overcharge and over heat cables
customer_reviews.text: I sent back my first and am reviewing the replacement for the same issue. It randomly tends to overcharge and over heat its own cables while charging. I have to baby sit it and look for the battery charge % not to move for awhile which is the indication that its locked up. Its a bit dangerous really and this unit will likely go back as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: lasted a yearr using maybe 1 time a month
customer_reviews.text: now going have buy another charger but unless they offer to replaced it 1 star if replaced it be a 4 or 5
customer_reviews.author: william t dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great charger for a home garage.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace another model from same mfr that died somehow. I actually like this model better as it easy to use. Only gripe is the selections are regular, agm, and another new type of battery I can’t recall now. I wanted to charge my trolling battery but can’t figure out which for a deep cycle battery. Instructions were vague on it, too. Otherwise, nice large clamps and easy to use. Only other complaint is the cord storage devices. Cheap plastic that doesn’t hold both cords.
customer_reviews.author: Carl P

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works really well on dead batteries. My car has a pretty significant drain, and will fully drain the battery after a few days. Now, I just have to hook this thing up and let it run for 5 minutes or so, and it will let me drive to the store AND have enough juice to turn the engine over for the drive home. I have an escalade, so it takes a lot to turn the engine. It even tells me how charged the battery is, and everything works automatically when hooked up.
customer_reviews.author: Janice L. Menke

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: The only things that keep it from getting five stars is that the clamps seem sort of flimsy and don't grip certain types of battery terminals well, and the cables get warm sometimes when charging which indicates that they should be a slightly heavier gauge. Otherwise it seems pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: ctx1050

customer_reviews.title: 3 Months and it CRAPPED OUT!  WHAT THE HELL???!?!?!?!??!
customer_reviews.text: Charger was used to maintain my RV battery and charge 3 vehicles that had been sitting 12 months. It's been in a closed compartment for storage in the trailer or in a Pickup bed with a sealed Tonneau. I live in Md. went to Az for 8 weeks in April/May. It worked fine out there. Get back and try to charge my boat battery, I got nothing. No lights, no indication, NOTHING! No connections on the board, or transformer had worked loose inside. This Automatic, microprocessor controlled, does everything but pick my nose crap is for the BIRDS. I'm breaking out my 35 year old Montgomery Wards 10A charger and hydrometer and doing it myself. NEVER AGAIN SCHUMACHER!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Derouin

customer_reviews.title: Failure
customer_reviews.text: Purchased original charger and used it one time then it quit. Called the company who replaced charger with another. The 2nd charger was used once then it quit. I would not recommend this charger.
customer_reviews.author: D Neu

customer_reviews.title: Good charger. Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Ive owned this model before, unfortunately, I accidentally left it in the rain, so here's the replacement. We own several pieces of equipment that occasionally go dead for various reasons, but we can always depend on this charger to get us up and running. The start feature is a real God send. Its a well made, heavy duty unit that's given us years of service, and we expect no less from this one as well. We own at least 15 different chargers, and fully half are this brand. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Carbonhead

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Silverado and Harley batteries
customer_reviews.text: Charged my 2017 Harley Davidson Street Glide Special big old battery from 0% overnight, 100% in the morning. Same with Chevy Silverado 1500 Tip: to avoid sparks while adjusting the clamps, plug it in after or hit Stop before you move the cables around. Was trying to get a good "bite" on the terminal and it went to auto charge so when I reconnected it sparked. The hook in the back to wrap the cables is a bit small and they dont stay put, thats the reason for a star off. And its heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little unit.
customer_reviews.text: This charger is absolutely awesome... plenty of charging power and easy to use. I like that it has the ability to charge various battery types and that it automatically goes into Maintain made when charging is complete.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Revived a dead jetski battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an incredibly cheap harbor freight charger and have been impressed with the increase in quality and features. I have 2 jetskis at a lake house that sit most of the year and are usually dead when it warms up enough to put them in the water, this charger has enabled us to charge up and repair the batteries enough to get another season out of the batteries when we used to have to replace the batteries. It charges them up pretty quick but the last 20% takes the longest. Very pleased with the product
customer_reviews.author: Charles Mynard

customer_reviews.title: Love this unit - very reliable, safe and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have charged my car battery with this when my lesser charger stopped working after a 1-2 years. Very easy to use! I have started my heavy diesel truck, JD tractor and charged the battery on my (too little used) Miata. Very safe and I feel MUCH better being able to not worry about hooking up then taking off the jumpers. MUCH safer than using my car with jumper cables! I can attach jumpers before turning it on and then turn it off before touching the jumpers again. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: kabuky

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these, disappointed by both. Not accurate at all. I'd like to go home at night and if I leave a battery on the charger, not worry about melting the shop. I had no faith in their accuracy. Switched to Solar brand, very impressed. This brand use to be good, somewhere something changed.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon S

customer_reviews.title: Safety concern... Did not shut off when battery was charged
customer_reviews.text: I had to give a star. Im not sure if the product I received was damaged, or if it is the norm. I used this product to charge the battery on my sons car & it apparently did not shut off when fully charged and overcharged the battery causing irreparable damage. I need to buy a new battery.
customer_reviews.author: great app!

customer_reviews.title: Safe and automatic.
customer_reviews.text: It is actually far more advanced than I had first read in the description. It's not just a battery charger. It is a troubleshooter for your electrical system for your car. It is far worth is money, and I would buy it again and recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Junior #'s 32:23

customer_reviews.title: Not made in China
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize how poor my Diehard charger worked that I have had for about 12 years which I thought worked well until I charged my first battery with this Schumacher SC1281 6/12V Fully Automatic Battery Charger. This new charger works fantastic, I recommend this charger, simple to use and it automatically chargers your battery, I mean it set's the charge rate according to what it thinks your battery needs, no guess work.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Works great, recommended for sure
customer_reviews.text: This charger is great. Has all the features for safety and ease of use. Reverse polarity feature is very nice feature. Older or less capable chargers would be a disaster if hooked up backwards and left, not this one. It is hefty for it's size and very good quality. When researching, I did not want a light duty unit and this very good quality and great. I researched many unit all with mixed reviews. This one delivers. A lot of people expect to bring old old batteries back from the grave it will not do that... For charging or maintaining good batteries this unit is the one you want and made by a great company! I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: GearHD 2019

customer_reviews.title: This is a lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: This charger is everything the manufacturer claims and more. I had a dead battery. It jump started my car instantly. It showed me that my alternator was charging the battery. It fully charged my battery in about an hour and shut off when the charge was complete. It shows you what percentage your battery is. It is so versatile, you can use it on any vehicle battery from a motorcycle to a large truck and it got delivered to me over night so I did not have to worry about calling for road service. This product was a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: W. L. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Charges at a dangerously high voltage  will cook the battery
customer_reviews.text: Useless, charging at 16.8 to 17 volts DC measured on VOM while connected, selecting AGM or GEL would not lower that voltage, charging at those voltages is most likely 30 amps + as there is no current meter but way too high will boil the battery and a AGM will bulge it as it would be gassing also. When one try did switch to maintain it was showing 14.5 volts still at a gassing voltage even in maintain, unacceptable, can't use this for anything other than a paper weight. Too bad we can't get a 2/15/125 manual unit like the old 125 units they worked great
customer_reviews.author: JAMES

customer_reviews.title: It works fine but the housing is easy to break
customer_reviews.text: I've used this to jump my 1997 Ford Expedition and to charge the battery on my 1998 Buick LeSabre. Works great for those purposes. But the plastic L-shaped pieces on the back that you're supposed to wrap the cables around break super easily, which is disappointing. They could have made them out of metal or something. They'll rip right off with barely any force, leaving broken bits of plastic rattling around inside of the housing.
customer_reviews.author: Josh P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value and Excellent Protection
customer_reviews.text: This charger is a fantastic value for the equipment. Easy to use, practically foolproof. After using other so-called "smart charger"s failing when charging various lithium batteries, this charger charges completely without damaging lithium batteries. During the recent sub-zero temps, I used this charger for quick startup of my tractors without fail. Provides excellent protections to safeguard charging and prevention of over-charging batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Rev. Pat Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, works as advertised, no surprises
customer_reviews.text: Car is not getting much use these days and the battery is 3 years old. Last trip to the grocery store had to be canceled because the car would turn over but not start. This arrived the morning after I ordered it and once it was hooked up it figured out the settings itself and got busy. 4 hours later it was done and the car started fine. Now I can take the car in for maintenance and worry less about needing to drive around just to charge the battery. Way fast shipping was a much appreciated plus.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift for my daughter, ITS A JOKE... This charger has to be plugged into an electric socket.. like what’s the point for use in an on the road emergency. grrrrr We just opened it because we needed a jump... Guess what?? useless!
customer_reviews.author: 5 star chic

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. My old charger said it was charging but it wasn’t. I don’t know how many lawnmower batteries I bought because it said they were bad and wouldn’t charge them. I love this one. It tells you where it’s at in the charging process and has a display screen to let you know how much it’s charged in %. It charged my lawnmower battery and my cars battery in no time.
customer_reviews.author: LWinfield3

customer_reviews.title: 2nd hand
customer_reviews.text: Charger arrived in original box which was beat up, when I opened the box the charger was not in any warping an the power cord was undone with no tie. One piece of paper for instructions which was vague an no warranty card to register the product . The battery charger seams to work OK but that beaning said with living in Florida I use a battery charger very little so hope this works out for me. Since this was a return maybe it is damaged internal, I do not know at $85.54 since it was a return I think $45.00 would have been appropriate.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Seems poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Charger works good. The front face plate sticker was falling off when it arrived. Not a good indicator of the quality of the rest of the unit. Probley should of returned it as if the sticker faceplate gets lost the buttons will be hard to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B.

customer_reviews.title: A great devise
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately am plagued with a vehicle whose battery discharges causing too frequent times I need to jump it. I use this devise regularly. I appreciate the “boost’ feature that which charges the battery quickly but will switch to 2amps/hour automatically . It then maintains a fully charged mode to maintain the battery. The device is well built and easy to use. I felt the cost of this device is very fair. JC
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Worked first time and has not since. Thought it was maybe a bad battery last time but just pulled it out again today to charge two brand new batteries for my boat and it is saying my batteries are bad.
customer_reviews.author: Maximilian Solon

customer_reviews.title: It worked
customer_reviews.text: It worked great. I had not started my vehicle in several months and it started right up. I wish the directions were a little clearer as I kept trying to clip the black clamp to chassis. It wasn't until friend advised clip black to the battery and red to positive. The video did not give that instruction either. But glad it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and delivered in less than 4 hours .
customer_reviews.text: Needed to use the lawn tractor but battery had died . Went to Amazon for a 12 volt battery charger found one that had more than I needed but the price was right . Ordered at 2pm , Shumacher SC1281 . It arrived at 7pm and had the battery charged in less than 30 min . It even checked for bad cells . I just pugged it in and attached the clips to the dead battery , job done .
customer_reviews.author: roland king

customer_reviews.title: This smart charger isn’t so smart.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could use on 6V motorcycle battery. Filled brand new battery w acid and proceeded to charge. This thing is supposedly smart enough to detect the correct voltage and charge rate for the battery type and size. Set it for standard battery and 6-2A charge and hit the button. There’s no way of knowing what voltage and rate it’s actually using, it doesn’t tell you. And of course no manual settings. So after 5 min the battery was boiling like crazy, shut it off and in diagnostic mode my 6V reads 8.6V! That’s bad. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Michaela M.

customer_reviews.title: Desulfated my battery
customer_reviews.text: I thought my battery was toast because I couldn't boost it with another car. Went to charge it with this thing and it ran in a desulfation mode. A few hours later the battery was working fine.
customer_reviews.author: sum hung guy

customer_reviews.title: It doesn’t charge a completely dead battery.
customer_reviews.text: Well this charger works well but it doesn’t charge a completely dead battery. It also puts out 16 to 18 volts and that well above what it should be. It does drop the voltage to 13.5 after awhile of charging. 14.5 to maybe 15 volts but no more.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Why?
customer_reviews.text: Still working a year later. Bought a battery minder and it died rather quickly, so i switched to this brand. The ironic thing is i still have a working battery charger that is 33 yo just the analog meter got a funky on it which is what enticed me to purchase all these other chargers, wish now i had just been satisfied with my old charger and a multimeter.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Opined Average Pessimist

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Schumacher products for years. But, no more. The digital display outputs 12V no matter what the charge really is on the battery. And, the percentage charge doesn't work either. Unfortunately, I missed the return window for this product before I needed to use it for the first time and found the problems. Don't buy this crap.
customer_reviews.author: NASA13

customer_reviews.title: Great charger
customer_reviews.text: This charge is fantastic. I hadn’t started my car in 8 months. This charger, charged the battery in 5 hours to full charge. It recognizes the different battery type which is helpful. I tried to charge a motorcycle battery that sat for several years in the charge tried to charge it then told me the battery is no good. If you hook up the terminals backwards it will not turn on and warns you.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used and used it immediately on both our cars. Used it on my car first, hooked it up and turned it on. It went thru all the cycles (Charged, desulfated and Charged/Maintained about an hour (my car was a little older). My wife's car 2nd it took about 3-4 hours from 35% to full charge. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel C. Vidal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I will never buy from this brand again. I received a faulty charger. Just when I needed it the most found out it didn't work. I suggest if you decide to purchase try it out soon after within the return wimdow just to test and make sure it works. Unfortunately I relied on the big name of Schumacher and assumed the quality would be great. In the end I had to pay for tow truck expenses. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa E

customer_reviews.title: A dud with poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. I tried several times to re-charge my battery. It just would not charge. And the instructions are very poorly written Finally I had replace the battery which cost me in excess of $200 at a nationwide battery and tire place. What a waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: Tiger- Mum

customer_reviews.title: Good charger
customer_reviews.text: I call this the "lieutenant" charger. It is very simple to use, and you cannot mess it up. It actually replaced an old trickle charger I had for about 20 years, that was working but now very well. Hooked this thing up, and it confirmed my issue was not the battery but in fact the charger. This is the exact same model that is sold at Walmart, but it was at least 10.00 cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrod A

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I have an older charger I thought was working until I was camping and my charger wasn't charging past 12.4 V and another battery measured 11.8 V max. This new charger showed 42% at 12 V checked the next morning at 100% 13.18V the other measured at 11.4 V and 37% again the next morning I had a 100% charge and measured 13.09 V The batteries were brand new deep cycle. First time using them. They started with 13.8 V as a matched set, connected in parallel for my camper.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed, a quality product
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, I placed it on Standard mode with 30amp Charging and brought one battery to life (94 Camaro, 2 year old battery, first reporting 7 volts). I have already charged my midsized SUVs battery ( Mercedes ML350) since it’s been sitting. I started using it as a battery tender for my sports car that doesn’t get used often too. I would highly recommend this product, especially nowadays where the cars aren’t leaving home very often, well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JDuarte

customer_reviews.title: Item failed after a couple of months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit for a couple of months and the six volt side of it quit working. And the diagnostic side of it also stopped working. Only charges twelve volts and shows no diagnostic read-out. I bought it for the six volt side as we have an old tractor and an old truck with six volt batteries. Have not contacted the manufacturer. I'll probably just buy an old fashioned mechanical 6 volt charger next time we go to town and send this one to the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: William Durden

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: My car needed a completely new battery...couldn't take a jump, used this to charge enough to drive it for repair. (I had already had AAA there the week before and they spent 3 hrs charging but then I had no where to take it by the time it was done due to everything was closed and AAA said it probley just sat too long, not that it was a dead battery.)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa H

customer_reviews.title: No support from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this to charge and start my small riding lawnmower but it did not seem to have the power to do so. It said the battery was ok and charged but it still would not jump the mower. When I reached out to the manufacturer I had a hard time even getting a response from them and when I did they were less than helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jonvt

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well
customer_reviews.text: Performs as expected. Recharged my car battery overnight that had been idle for two months ... full charge and battery is performing well. I like the charger switches to a trickle charge once it detects that the battery is fully charged ... I will start using this feature when I know my car will be idle for long periods of time. Definitely recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a good, but dead battery.
customer_reviews.text: Due to our states shelter in place, our car was not driven in over 3 weeks! The battery was new last year, but unfortunately died due to no use. Luckily, this charger had it up and running in 4 hours... 2 weeks later, no issues and car is great. This battery charger was a great purchase and piece of mind for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good buy
customer_reviews.text: I have a smaller charger maintainer I bought at Aldi which did not charge my Mustang battery which discharged over the winter. This one allowed me to jump start it within 5 minutes. I then charged the dead battery and now I don’t have to shell out $150 for a new one. Really great product.
customer_reviews.author: Andre Bouravnev

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an infrequently used vehicle
customer_reviews.text: I have an old truck that has an electronic packrat deterrent under the hood. The truck does not have working air conditioning, so it often sits dormant over the summer months. I use this to keep the battery ready to start when I've kept the truck stationary for so long.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Gave strange readouts - hard to use
customer_reviews.text: It said my battery was empty, then when charging gave no indication as to what the exact charging level was in the battery. Similar to other comments, something like this should ust work out of the box, not make you do backflips to understand what is going on.
customer_reviews.author: DJSquared

customer_reviews.title: Best Battery Charger I've ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: What a GREAT find. Takes all the guess work out of your charging status. It also has a Quick Charge 30 amp, 100 amp starting and trickle/maintain range. The readout tells you exactly what happening during the charge. Couldn't be happier. I highly recommend this charger.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred R. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Overcharges and kills batteries
customer_reviews.text: Ate 2 batteries. Couldn't return to Amazon due to time (almost 90 DAYS). Schumacher return process is complicated starting with it taking 15 minutes to get to a live person and another 15 on hold until they come back and explain their process which requires going to a special website, taking/uploading pics and yet another 15 minutes online. Caveat Emptor.
customer_reviews.author: DaveyKissoff

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my garage in case i needed..I got a harley davidson the battery is kinda low so the bike wont start..Hooked up the battery charger and put it on 100 amp setting and still did not do much...I should of bought a shop charger..Cant say its junk but ill keep testing...
customer_reviews.author: Len Ricupero

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I brought this one and another high rated "Battery Tender 022-0209-DL-WH" at the same time. When I tried them on an almost dead battery, the other one refused to charge and jump start the vehicle. While this one, it sump started the car and started charging. There may be minor issues related to the % of charging. when it reached about 70%, I unplugged the electricity, started the car without a problem. But when I plugged back the power, it shows 0% for the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A multi functional and easy to use charger.
customer_reviews.text: I love this charger. I had an earlier model by this manufacturer for 25 years before it was damaged and it always worked well. I love the versatility of this charger, and its capacity to restore old batteries. The new digital controls are a nice upgrade. I am sure I will enjoy using this unit for years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Received used item
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt of this item it was visually obvious it had already been used. The seals on the box and the box itself had been not so gently opened. The battery charger was in the box upside down, making it obvious that it had scuff marks on the bottom from what looks like being dragged across the ground. You could tell just by looking at the clamps that they had been used. This was not supposed to be a used or even refurbished item. The charger worked on the one battery we tried it on but without knowing why it was returned after use we can only hope it continues to work.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this charger is not worth it at all
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product I use it twice and halfway through a charge it's shut off and never came back on the tech support was no help I don't recommend this for anyone and to send it back is in joke
customer_reviews.author: Richard wickkiser

customer_reviews.title: Good, automatic battery charger
customer_reviews.text: Charged up a dead car battery with no problems. I also have numerous motorcycle sized batteries for electric start of a riding mower, a push mower, power sprayer, and electric mobility scooter...it can recharge these as necessary, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary LLL Williams

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Wouldn’t even turn on initially and the buttons are cheap feeling. Only place this belongs is in the garbage can it feels like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas M

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: Charger works great. Used it on the battery for my 1998 Porsche Boxster. Threw my back out so I couldn't drive for a couple of weeks. Car wouldn't start, but two hours of charging and car started right up. Price is great considering the options it has. No regrets with this purchase. Price is comparable to Schumacher chargers sold at auto chain stores.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Over the winter my 2wd pick-up see's minimal use, in favor of a 4wd SUV. The battery in my pick-up would lose some power and always needed a jump to start. I order this battery charger and received in 2 days . When I connected the charger to my battery it showed only 11.6 volts, I then started the charging process. It only took about 2 hours to charge the battery up to 100%. The charger completed the charging cycle and turned it's self off. With nicer weather here I use the pick-up more often and have had no issues starting. I would recommend this battery charger to my family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: ROY A COOK

customer_reviews.title: The Charger that Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I just received this this PM. My neighbor's daughter went away to school and left her 2012 Honda sitting "beside the garage". this charger took awhile about an hour) to completely charge. It is a bit heavier than my former (25 year old) . The instructions are straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Effective and Safe
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this unit, it charges both of my Cummins' batteries at once, but isn't too much horsepower to use as a trickle charger.
customer_reviews.author: Alex McB

product_meta.title: Schumacher SC1281 6/12V Fully Automatic Battery Charger and 30/100A Engine Starter with Advanced Diagnostic Testing
product_meta.description: Charge or jump start your SUV, truck, or large battery with the Schumacher SC1281 6/12V Fully Automatic Battery Charger and 30/100A Engine Starter. Contains battery and alternator tester which provides charge level and helps diagnose electrical problems. Features 30A for quick energy boost and 100A to jump start your car right away. Microprocessor controlled, multi-stage charging adds precision, safety and battery life. Built-in reverse hook-up protection prevents charger from operating if clamps are reversed. LED indicators and Start/Stop push button interface improves accuracy and ease of use. Features auto voltage detection to easily detect 6 or 12V batteries. Meets the highest industry standards with its Schu Eco Energy. DOE compliant. Compatible with standard, AGM, gel, and deep-cycle batteries.
feature_bullets: Features 30A quick boost and 100A jump start, powerful enough to start SUVs, trucks and large batteries
Battery and alternator tester provides charge level and helps diagnose electrical problems
Features multi-stage charging and auto-voltage detection for added precision, safety and battery life. UL Safety Certifications
Reverse hook-up protection ensures charger will not operate if clamps are reversed
Charges compatible battery types, including standard, AGM, gel and deep-cycle batteries

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,724 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars

categories: Jump Starters, Battery Chargers & Portable Power
